questions.text: Which of the following is not used in treatment of Syndrome of inappropriate ADH secretion?

A 28-year-old man presented with headaches, visual impairment and behavioural changes. Clinically, the patient was found to have hypogonadism and bitemporal hemianopia. A MRI demonstrated a pituitary tumour 1.5 cm in diameter and blood tests revealed a serum prolactin of 700?mcg/L (reference range <20 mcg/L). What should be the first line treatment?

A 34-year-old male patient experiencing impotence was found to have increased prolactin and low testosterone concentrations. Patient is a known case of migraine and takes verapamil as prophylaxis and sumatriptan for acute attack since last 10 years. Magnetic resonance imaging showed a 6-mm lesion consistent with a pituitary microadenoma. What should be the next line of management?
A middle-aged man noticed that he can no longer fit in his shoes and that his jaw was protruding and phalanges were enlarged. Which investigation will confirm the diagnosis?
All are associated with pituitary apoplexy except:
A 24-year-old female meets with an accident with resultant transaction of the pituitary stalk; what will NOT occur:

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in serum osmolality and decrease in urine osmolality

questions.text: Choose the best Lab value for a patient with nephrogenic diabetes insipidus
A 30-year-old male complains of loss of erection; he has low testosterone and high prolactin level in blood; What is the likely diagnosis:
In a patient suffering from thyrotoxicosis the thyroid scintigraphy is as shown in the figure the most likely diagnosis is:

A 32-year-old female, known case of diabetes, was brought to emergency department with breathing difficulty, nausea, vomiting, history of fever and cough since last 3 to 4 days. On examination pulse 76 beats per min, BP 130/80 mmhg. Respiratory system- tachypnoea present, bilateral air entry equal, no crepitations or spasm. Blood glucose level – 489 mg/dl, ECG is shown in the figure. Which of the following sentence is correct regarding above case?

options.label: A
options.text: Patient is having lower respiratory tract infection leading to syndrome of inappropriate ADH secretion and ECG is suggestive of hypokalemia.

options.label: B
options.text: Patient is suffering from hyperosmolar hyperglycemic state and ECG is suggestive of hyperkalemia

options.label: C
options.text: Patient is suffering from diabetic acidosis and ECG is suggestive of hyperkalemia

options.label: D
options.text: Patient is having upper respiratory tract infection and ECG suggestive of acute myocardial infarction.

questions.correct_answer: C. Patient is suffering from diabetic acidosis and ECG is suggestive of hyperkalemia

questions.text: A 66-year-old woman brought to the emergency department with reduced level of consciousness. On enquiry relatives gave history of fever, cough with expectoration since last 1 week. She is also a known case of some thyroid disorder. On presentation, her vital signs included a temperature of 31.2°C (88.2°F), heart rate of 46?bpm and blood pressure of 110/86?mm?Hg. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 45 years old obese male patient known case of type 2 diabetes mellitus since 2 years on insulin mixtard (30/70) presented with fasting hyperglycaemia (FBG-260 mg/dl) and generalized muscle weakness. On examination, he was conscious, BMI-27kg/m2, pulse rate 90/mm, BP 130/90 mmHg. Examination of central nervous system, gastrointestinal and cardiovascular system was non-contributory. He had no family history of diabetes.Laboratory investigations revealed haemoglobin 11.2 g/dl with normal renal, lipid and hepatic profile. HBA1C was 8.4%. He was taking mixtard insulin (30/70) 16 units before breakfast and 16 units before dinner as prescribed by a local practitioner. As his blood sugar could not be controlled, the practitioner increased the dose to 25 units before breakfast and 25 units before dinner. Following this he came to OPD with complaints of night sweats and night mares since 2 weeks and generalized weakness during evening hours. He was advised for self-monitoring of blood glucose (with glucometer) 5 times daily for next three days at 7 am (fasting), 1 pm, 8 pm (before dinner) 10 pm (before going to bed) and 2 am (next day). Various findings of blood sugar measured in mg/dl are shown in the table: - What is the most probable diagnosis and treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Dawn phenomenon and increase the dose of insulin

options.label: B
options.text: Somogyi effect and decrease the dose of insulin

options.label: C
options.text: Maturity onset diabetes of young and add oral hypoglycaemic drugs

options.label: D
options.text: Hyperosmolar hyperglycaemic state and give insulin infusion

questions.correct_answer: B. Somogyi effect and decrease the dose of insulin

questions.text: A 75-year-old man presents with development of abdominal obesity, proximal myopathy, and skin hyperpigmentation. His laboratory evaluation shows a hypokalemic metabolic alkalosis. Which of the following statements regarding this syndrome is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Basal ACTH level is likely to be low.

options.label: B
options.text: Circulating corticotropin-releasing hormone is likely to be elevated.

options.label: C
options.text: Pituitary magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) will visualize all ACTH-secreting tumors.

options.label: D
options.text: Serum potassium level <3.3 mmol/L is suggestive of ectopic ACTH production.

questions.correct_answer: D. Serum potassium level <3.3 mmol/L is suggestive of ectopic ACTH production.

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding LARON’S syndrome?

A 45-year-old man reports to his primary care physician that his wife has noted coarsening of his facial features over several years. Physical examination shows frontal bossing and enlarged hands. An MRI confirms that he has a pituitary mass. Which of the following screening tests should be ordered to diagnose the cause of the mass?

options.label: B
options.text: GH suppression test by oral glucose load

questions.correct_answer: D. Serum insulin-like growth factor-1 (IGF-1) level

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman who is otherwise healthy undergoes an uneventful vaginal delivery of a full-term infant. One day postpartum, she complains of visual changes and severe headache. Two hours after these complaints, she is found unresponsive and profoundly hypotensive. She is intubated and placed on mechanical ventilation. Her blood pressure is 68/28 mmHg, regular heart rate is 148 bpm, her oxygen saturation is 95% on fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) of 0.40. Her laboratory tests are notable for glucose of 49 mg/dL, with normal haematocrit and white blood cell count. Which of the following is most likely to reverse her hypotension?

options.label: A
options.text: Transfusion of packed red blood cells

questions.text: Which of the following is the agent of choice for treating thyrotoxicosis during pregnancy first trimester?
Which of the following is not associated with hypothyroidism:

options.label: A
options.text: Difficulty in concentrating and poor memory

questions.text: The lab investigation of patient shows normal T4 and increased TSH. Correct diagnosis is:-
The occurrence of hyperthyroidism following administration of supplemental iodine to subjects with endemic iodine deficiency goiter is known as:

A patient is having perioral numbness and tingling sensations all over body. Lab investigations are as follow serum ionised calcium decreased, serum phosphate level increased, urinary cAMP normal, serum parathyroid hormone level increased. What is the correct diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a feature of hypercalcemia:
Which of the following cannot differentiate Diabetic ketoacidosis with hyperosmolar hyperglycaemic state?
All of the following cannot diiferentiate Cushing’s disease with Ectopic ACTH secreting tumor

A 75-year-old lady with fracture neck of femur presents with two days history of altered sensorium and decreased urinary output. Serum calcium is 15.5 mg/dL, Urea is 140 mg/dL, Creatinine is 2 mg/dL. All of the following are useful for immediate management of hypercalcemia, except:
Glucokinase deficiency causes which type of Maturity onset diabetes of young?
